title: أَمْ الْمُتَّصِلَةُ وَالْمُنْقَطِعَةُ
description: Learn about the two types of أم - المتصلة (connected, for exclusive choice) and المنقطعة (disconnected, introducing a new clause meaning 'or rather/but').

notes.title: Introduction to أم
content: أَمْ is a conjunction particle that has two distinct types: الْمُتَّصِلَة (connected) and الْمُنْقَطِعَة (disconnected). Understanding the difference is essential for proper comprehension of Arabic questions and statements.
The two types have different meanings, grammatical functions, and contexts. Confusing them leads to misunderstanding sentences.

examples.english: Is Zayd with you or Amr? (connected)
Indeed it is one of the greatest - or isn't it? (disconnected)
Is Zayd standing or sitting?
Are you more difficult to create or the sky?

notes.title: أم المتصلة (Connected Am)
content: أَمْ الْمُتَّصِلَة is used in questions asking to specify which of two (or more) options is the case. It follows هَمْزَة الاسْتِفْهَام (أَ) or sometimes هَلْ. The answer must be one of the options, not yes/no.

It is called 'connected' because the two parts are grammatically connected - they share the same question. The meaning is 'which of these?' Example: أَزَيْدٌ جَاءَ أَمْ عَمْرٌو؟ (Which one came - Zayd or Amr?)

examples.english: Did Zayd come or Amr? (Answer: Zayd or Amr)
Do you want tea or coffee?
Do you plant it or are We the planters? (Quran)
Is this correct or wrong?

notes.title: أم المنقطعة (Disconnected Am)
content: أَمْ الْمُنْقَطِعَة introduces a new, separate clause. It doesn't offer a choice but rather means 'or (actually),' 'or rather,' 'but,' or introduces a rhetorical question. It can follow statements or questions.

It is called 'disconnected' because what follows is grammatically independent. The meaning is close to بَلْ (rather) + أَ (question). Example: أَمْ تُرِيدُونَ أَنْ تَسْأَلُوا = بَلْ أَتُرِيدُونَ (Or do you want...?).

examples.arabic: هَلْ زَيْدٌ فِي الدَّارِ أَمْ هَلْ رَأَيْتَهُ؟
examples.english: Is Zayd home, or have you seen him? (two separate questions)
Indeed it is one of the greatest - isn't it?
Or do you intend to ask your Messenger? (Quran)
Or did you think you would enter Paradise? (Quran)

notes.title: How to Distinguish Between Them
content: To distinguish: 1) المتصلة must be preceded by همزة التسوية or همزة الاستفهام in a question seeking specification. 2) المنقطعة follows statements or questions where بَلْ أَ could replace it.

Test: Can you replace أَمْ with أَيُّهُمَا (which of them)? If yes = متصلة. Can you replace with بَلْ أَ? If yes = منقطعة. Also: does the answer need to specify one option = متصلة, or is it a new question = منقطعة.

examples.english: Zayd or Amr = which one? → connected
Or do you want = rather, do you want? → disconnected

examples.arabic: سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ → متصلة
examples.english: Same to them whether you warn or not → connected (همزة التسوية)
Or do they have partners? → disconnected

notes.title: Grammatical Analysis
content: أَمْ الْمُتَّصِلَة: حَرْف عَطْف (conjunction particle). What follows is معطوف على (conjoined to) what came before the أَمْ. Both parts share the same grammatical structure.
أَمْ الْمُنْقَطِعَة: حَرْف ابْتِدَاء (initiating particle) - starts a new clause. Some call it حَرْف إِضْرَاب (particle of correction). What follows is a new, independent sentence.

examples.arabic: أَزَيْدٌ أَمْ عَمْرٌو: أَمْ حرف عطف، عَمْرٌو معطوف على زَيْدٌ
examples.english: أَمْ: conjunction, عَمْرٌو conjoined to زَيْدٌ

examples.arabic: أَمْ تُرِيدُونَ: أَمْ حرف ابتداء، تُرِيدُونَ جملة مستقلة
examples.english: أَمْ: initiating particle, تُرِيدُونَ independent sentence
Connected أَمْ: parsed as conjunction
Disconnected أَمْ: parsed as initiating particle

notes.title: Quranic Examples
content: Both types appear frequently in the Quran. الْمُتَّصِلَة often appears with هَمْزَة التَّسْوِيَة (equating hamza): سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ (It's equal whether you warn them or not).
الْمُنْقَطِعَة appears in rhetorical questions: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَنْ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ (Or did you think you'd enter Paradise?). Understanding which type helps with proper tafsir.

examples.arabic: سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ (البقرة: ٦)
examples.english: It is equal whether you warn them or not (2:6) - متصلة
Are you harder to create or the sky? (79:27) - متصلة
Or did you think you'd enter Paradise? (2:214) - منقطعة
Or do they have gods protecting them? (21:43) - منقطعة

exercises.prompt: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَنْ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ - 'أَمْ' هُنَا _____
exercises.promptEn: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَنْ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ - 'أَمْ' here is _____
أَمْ المتصلة comes after the interrogative _____

exercises.prompt: أَمْ الْمُنْقَطِعَةُ يُمْكِنُ اسْتِبْدَالُهَا بِـ: _____ + أَ
exercises.promptEn: أَمْ المنقطعة can be replaced with: _____ + أَ

exercises.prompt: أَمْ الْمُتَّصِلَةُ حَرْفُ _____، وَأَمْ الْمُنْقَطِعَةُ حَرْفُ ابْتِدَاء
exercises.promptEn: أَمْ المتصلة is a _____ particle, while أَمْ المنقطعة is an initiating particle

exercises.prompt: سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ - هَذِهِ أَمْ _____ مَعَ هَمْزَةِ التَّسْوِيَةِ
exercises.promptEn: سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ - this أَمْ is _____ with همزة التسوية

exercises.answer: Connected أَمْ (offers choice between options in a question)
Disconnected أَمْ (introduces new clause, means 'or rather')
The equating hamza (used with سَوَاء showing equal options)

exercises.prompt: The أَمْ that offers a choice between options and follows همزة الاستفهام
The أَمْ that means 'or rather' and can be replaced with بَلْ أَ
Identify the type: أَتُرِيدُ شَايًا أَمْ قَهْوَةً؟
